bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Harry Clemons, May 15, 1940

div1.p: Hench returns Kelly's book on Reed to the Alderman Library at the University of Virginia. He hopes to receive a copy of the Moran - Kean correspondence from Kean himself. The originals are at the University of Virginia.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Harry Clemons, May 15, 1940
div1.opener:
Yellow fever
May 15, 1940
Mr. Harry Clemons, Librarian
University of Virginia
Alderman Library
Charlottesville, Virginia
My dear Mr. Clemons:
div1.p:
I certainly appreciate your kindness in
lending me Kelly's book on yellow fever. Since my return,
I have been very fortunate, and have obtained a copy. I
am returning it to you, insured for twenty dollars.

I have written General Kean, asking for
permission to get a carbon or photostatic copy of the
letter you have. He has written saying that he is sending
permission but thinks that he may have a copy himself to
send me. When I get my own story and researches on the
work assembled, I shall be delighted to send you a copy,
but this will take many weeks or months.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
